result.execSummary:
The defendant Eric Ray Brasson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess w/Intent-THC (<=200 grams), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(h)1.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed
supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: consecutive to any other sentence; release for work, inmate work assignments, The Day Reporting Center; with credit for 61 days (3-29-2015 to 04-01-2015, 06-05-2015 to 8-5-2015) time served. Court notes a strong objection to electronic monitoring.
Probation review hearing scheduled for 12-04-2015 at 1:30 pm.

miscConds.notes: Pay all mandatory court costs, fees, assessments and surcharges, including the DNA surcharge, during the course of probation to the probation agent. Any remaining balance due at the end of probation will become immediately due or civil judgment to be entered.

Regularly participate in an HSED or GED program until completed. 
Maintain fulltime employment.

No possession of any firearms or weapons, firearm ammunition, firearm magazine, firearm holster, or any body armor.
Defendant may not live where a firearm is kept. 
Defendant may not be in any automobile where a firearm is present. 
Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes section 973.176, the Court advised the defendant of the following restrictions:  Firearm possession and Voting.

No use or possession/use of alcohol or controlled substances without a valid prescription taken in the manner and fashion as prescribed.
No possession of any drug paraphernalia for personal use, manufacturing, delivering or for distribution.
No possession of more than one cell phone at any one time.
Defendant my not have more than one phone number registered to you name at one time. 
Defendant to not associate with any known gang member, associate or affiliate. 
Geographic are restriction WITHIN area bordered on:
*North by Highland Blvd., Milwaukee, WI  
* South by Wisconsin Ave., Milwaukee, WI 
* East by 25th Street, Milwaukee, WI 
* West by 35th Street, Milwaukee, WI
For the reasons placed on the record, the Court GRANTED the Defense request for expungement upon successfully completion of probation.

Court ordered Defendant to comply with all child support court orders and/or any paternity actions.
Defendant to participate in a Cognitive Behavior program.
Fine is set at ZERO.
No drivers license suspension imposed. 
Provide DNA sample, if not already done.

Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment and successfully complete recommended treatment.  Maintain Absolute Sobriety.
Department of Corrections must conduct drug and alcohol testing at least 1 time per month for the first year of probation.

timeConds.notes: without goodtime credit; release for The Day Reporting Center, verified work, and inmate work assignments. Court notes a strong objection to electronic monitoring.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Eric Ray Brasson

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Eric Ray Brasson in court. Danielle Chojnacki on behalf of Brandon A Wigley appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: tmk.
  Probation Agent is in court.  Probation Status Review report filed and reviewed.  Defendant is compliant or mostly compliant with probation.  The remaining condition time is stayed and agent may request if needed.  Court found that further review is not needed.
Probation Status Review from agent DeCaire, Received and filed. tk

Defendant Eric Ray Brasson in court with attorney Louis Edward Epps.  Patricia I. Daugherty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Deputy Court Clerk: tmk.
AS TO COUNT 1 -
Court ordered defendant to serve 12 MONTHS in the House of Correction consecutive to any other sentence; release for work, inmate work assignments, The Day Reporting Center; with credit for 61 days (3-29-2015 to 04-01-2015, 06-05-2015 to 8-5-2015) time served. Court notes a strong objection to electronic monitoring. 
COURT STAYED THE SENTENCE and placed defendant on probation for 2 YEARS.
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:

- Maintain Absolute Sobriety: No use or possession/use of alcohol or controlled substances without a valid prescription taken in the manner and fashion as prescribed.
- Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment and successfully complete recommended treatment.  
- Department of Corrections must conduct drug and alcohol testing at least 1 time per month for the first year of probation.
 - No possession of any drug paraphernalia for personal use, manufacturing, delivering or for distribution.
- No possession of more than one cell phone at any one time.
- Defendant my not have more than one phone number registered to you name at one time. 
- No possession of any firearms or weapons, firearm ammunition, firearm magazine, firearm holster, or any body armor.
- Defendant may not live where a firearm is kept. 
- Defendant may not be in any automobile where a firearm is present. 
- Regularly participate in an HSED or GED program until completed. 
- Maintain fulltime employment. 
- Defendant to not associate with any known gang member, associate or affiliate. 
- Geographic are restriction WITHIN area bordered on 
*North by Highland Blvd., Milwaukee, WI  
* South by Wisconsin Ave., Milwaukee, WI 
* East by 25th Street, Milwaukee, WI 
* West by 35th Street, Milwaukee, WI 
- Court ordered Defendant to comply with all child support court orders and/or any paternity actions.
- Defendant to participate in a Cognitive Behavior program.
- Fine is set at ZERO.
- No drivers license suspension imposed. 
- Provide DNA sample, if not already done. 

- Court ordered defendant to serve 6 MONTHS CONDITION TIME  in the House of Correction without goodtime credit; release for The Day Reporting Center, verified work, and inmate work assignments. Court notes a strong objection to electronic monitoring. 
- Pay all mandatory court costs, fees, assessments and surcharges, including the DNA surcharge, during the course of probation to the probation agent. Any remaining balance due at the end of probation will become immediately due or civil judgment to be entered. 
- Probation review hearing scheduled for 12-04-2015 at 1:30 pm.

Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes section 973.176, the Court advised the defendant of the following restrictions:  Firearm possession and Voting.

Appellate rights notice given to the defendant. 

Filed;
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief;
Pretrial Incarceration Credit.

For the reasons placed on the record, the Court GRANTED the Defense request for expungement upon successfully completion of probation.
  Probation Review Hearing scheduled for December 4, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Eric Ray Brasson in court.  Brandon A Wigley appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: tmk.
Held off the record. Case set for sentencing hearing. Court was notified through Attorney Sargent that Attorney Epps is in trial today and unable to attend today's proceedings. Court ordered case adjourned for sentencing hearing on 08-26-2015 at 8:30 am, branch 17. Sentencing Hearing scheduled on August 26, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Eric Ray Brasson in court with attorney Louis Edward Epps.  Paul M. Hauer on behalf of Brandon Wigley appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy court clerk ccp.
BRANCH 25 FOR BRANCH 17. Case set for plea and sentencing hearing. Parties are prepared to proceed. State placed negotiations on the record. Plea hearing proceeded.
Defendant sworn in.

As to COUNT 1-
Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, Addendum, and Jury Instructions received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Court found the defendant guilty.  Judgment of conviction entered.
  
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess any gun or other firearms. 
Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.  

Court advised defendant if he is not a citizen of the United States of America, that upon a plea of guilty or no contest for this offense, he could be deported, excluded from admission to his country, or denied naturalization under federal law.  
Court advised that the defendant will have to provide a DNA sample, to the Wisconsin State Crime Laboratory for DNA testing and pay a DNA surcharge.

Court ordered defendant REMANDED into custody. 
Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgment received and filed.
Due to the lateness of the hour, Court is unable to proceed to sentencing today. Case adjourned to Branch 17. 
  Sentencing hearing scheduled for August 17, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Branch 17 in jury trial on another matter, case spun to Branch 25.

Attorney Louis Edward Epps in court, defendant Eric Ray Brasson not in court, in custody.  Brandon A Wigley appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case in court for plea and sentencing, however the defendant is in custody in Juno County with a release date of 07/31/2015, and was not produced for today's proceedings.  State did submit and order to produce for today's proceedings on 06/08/2015.  Due to the defendant not being present, the Court granted the parties request for an adjournment. Case adjourned to Branch 17.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for August 4, 2015 at 08:30 am.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Discharge Summary Report, dated June 8, 2015 received and filed. tk
Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for inhanced Supervision.  All other conditions of bail to remain the same.
Bail motion by the state argued and granted by the Court.  Cash Bail set at $250.00.

Attorney Louis Edward Epps in court, defendant Eric Ray Brasson not in court, in custody, not produced.  Paul Hauer on behalf of Brandon A Wigley appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: tmk.
Case set for plea and sentencing hearing. For reasons placed on the record defendant failed to appear. Court orders case adjourned for plea and sentencing, Branch 17.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for June 19, 2015 at 08:30 am.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report dated June 4, 2015 received and filed. tk
Notice of Motion and Motion to Modify bail received and filed. tk
Milwaukee County Pretrial Services Violation Report : Missed Telephone Contact. received and filed.

Defendant Eric Ray Brasson in court with attorney Louis Edward Epps.  Brandon A Wigley appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
ORIGINAL COURT FILE IS UNAVAILABLE. 
Case held off the record for the purposes of scheduling. Defense counsel received discovery and offer.  Court orders case adjourned for projected Plea and Sentencing on 6-5-2015 at 8:30 a.m., Br. 17.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for June 5, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Justice Point Pretrial Report dated May 7, 2015, received and filed.

Defendant Eric Ray Brasson in court with attorney Louis Edward Epps.  Zachary Wittchow for Brandon A Wigley appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed.  Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Stark, Branch 17.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pleads not guilty.  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 8, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Justice Point Report

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION.   
Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with 848 N 27th Street.
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Eric Ray Brasson in court with attorney Gabriela A. Leija.  Defendant Eric Ray Brasson in custody.  Karen A. Loebel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Stark, Branch 17.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 10, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
